Detailed Description

Chemical system of the cell (reactions).

This class defines the chemical system of a cell. It defines all the reaction channels through the stoichiometric matrix, and the function computing the propensities of reaction channels.

Member Data Documentation

int ChemicalSystem::nSpecies_

Number of chemical species.

int ChemicalSystem::nChannels_

Number of reaction channels.

Array<int,2> ChemicalSystem::stoichMatrix_

Stoichiometric matrix of the chemical reactions.

Its dimension should be nChannels x nSpecies.

void(* ChemicalSystem::computePropensitiesPtr_)(const Array< int, 1 > &x, Array< double, 1 > &propensities)

Pointer to the function that computes the propensities of the different reaction channels.

The function is meant to be written by an external program. Otherwise, it can be directly included in the ChemicalSystem class.

void(* ChemicalSystem::computePropensitiesTimeDependentPtr_)(const Array< int, 1 > &x, const double t, const double t0, const double tc, Array< double, 1 > &propensities)

Pointer to the function that computes the propensities of the different reaction channels.

The function is meant to be written by an external program. Otherwise, it can be directly included in the ChemicalSystem class. Time-dependent version. For example, for a variable volume with second-order reactions.
